extendedIngredients.name: baby potatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 16 ounces baby red potatoes, halved (or quartered if large so they cook through)

extendedIngredients.name: green beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 16 ounces green beans, trimmed (my store sells bags of pre-trimmed green beans. If you can't find those, just cut off the ends)
metaInformation: (my store sells bags of pre-trimmed beans. If you can't find those, just cut off the ends)

extendedIngredients.name: ranch salad dressing mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (1-ounce) package Ranch Seasoning and Salad Dressing Mix

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

recipes.title: One Dish Ranch Pork Chops & Veggies

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Chardonnay, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Pork Chops. Chardonnay suits simple chops or chops in a butter or cream sauce, dry riesling complements sweet additions like honey mustard or apples, and pinot noir is a safe bet for pork dishes in general. One wine you could try is Chateau Ste. Michelle Cold Creek Vineyard Riesling. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 15 dollars.

productMatches.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle Cold Creek Vineyard Riesling
productMatches.description: The Cold Creek Riesling is made from 40-year-old vines which contribute fruit intensity and concentration. This is a ripe, lush style of Riesling with aromas of ripe peaches, dried apricots and spice notes. It displays beautiful ripe fruit flavors with a crisp finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a large baking sheet with non stick spray.Place pork chops, halved potatoes and trimmed green beans in a single layer onto the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with Ranch Seasoning and garlic. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.Place into oven and roast until the pork is completely cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 140 degrees F, about 20-22 minutes. Then broil on high for 2-3 minutes, or until caramelized and slightly charred.Serve immediately, garnished with parsley, if desired.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a large baking sheet with non stick spray.
Place pork chops, halved potatoes and trimmed green beans in a single layer onto the prepared baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with Ranch Seasoning and garlic. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.

Place into oven and roast until the pork is completely cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 140 degrees F, about 20-22 minutes. Then broil on high for 2-3 minutes, or until caramelized and slightly charred.
Serve immediately, garnished with parsley, if desired.
